creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: From LFI to RCE: Active Exploitation Detected in Gladinet and TrioFox Vulnerability
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Cybersecurity company Huntress said it has observed active in-the-wild exploitation of an unpatched security flaw impacting Gladinet CentreStack and TrioFox products.
The zero-day vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-11371 (CVSS score: 6.1), is an unauthenticated local file inclusion bug that allows unintended disclosure of system files. It impacts all versions of the software prior to and
contentSnippet:

creator: Lily Hay Newman
title: Apple Announces $2 Million Bug Bounty Reward for the Most Dangerous Exploits
dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman
content: With the mercenary spyware industry booming, Apple VP Ivan Krstić tells WIRED that the company is also offering bonuses that could bring the max total reward for iPhone exploits to $5 million.
contentSnippet: With the mercenary spyware industry booming, Apple VP Ivan Krstić tells WIRED that the company is also offering bonuses that could bring the max total reward for iPhone exploits to $5 million.

creator: Matt Burgess
title: North Korean Scammers Are Doing Architectural Design Now
dc:creator: Matt Burgess
content: New research shows that North Koreans appear to be trying to trick US companies into hiring them to develop architectural designs using fake profiles, résumés, and Social Security numbers.
contentSnippet: New research shows that North Koreans appear to be trying to trick US companies into hiring them to develop architectural designs using fake profiles, résumés, and Social Security numbers.

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: CL0P-Linked Hackers Breach Dozens of Organizations Through Oracle Software Flaw
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Dozens of organizations may have been impacted following the zero-day exploitation of a security flaw in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS) software since August 9, 2025, Google Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) and Mandiant said in a new report released Thursday.
"We're still assessing the scope of this incident, but we believe it affected dozens of organizations," John Hultquist, chief analyst of

creator: Reece Rogers, Lily Hay Newman
title: Apple Took Down These ICE-Tracking Apps. The Developers Aren't Giving Up
dc:creator: Reece Rogers, Lily Hay Newman
content: “We are going to do everything in our power to fight this,” says ICEBlock developer Joshua Aaron after Apple removed his app from the App Store.
contentSnippet: “We are going to do everything in our power to fight this,” says ICEBlock developer Joshua Aaron after Apple removed his app from the App Store.

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: From HealthKick to GOVERSHELL: The Evolution of UTA0388's Espionage Malware
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
A China-aligned threat actor codenamed UTA0388 has been attributed to a series of spear-phishing campaigns targeting North America, Asia, and Europe that are designed to deliver a Go-based implant known as GOVERSHELL.

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: New ClayRat Spyware Targets Android Users via Fake WhatsApp and TikTok Apps
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
A rapidly evolving Android spyware campaign called ClayRat has targeted users in Russia using a mix of Telegram channels and lookalike phishing websites by impersonating popular apps like WhatsApp, Google Photos, TikTok, and YouTube as lures to install them.
"Once active, the spyware can exfiltrate SMS messages, call logs, notifications, and device information; taking photos with the front

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: Hackers Access SonicWall Cloud Firewall Backups, Spark Urgent Security Checks
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
SonicWall on Wednesday disclosed that an unauthorized party accessed firewall configuration backup files for all customers who have used the cloud backup service.
"The files contain encrypted credentials and configuration data; while encryption remains in place, possession of these files could increase the risk of targeted attacks," the company said.
It also noted that it's working to notify all

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: ThreatsDay Bulletin: MS Teams Hack, MFA Hijacking, $2B Crypto Heist, Apple Siri Probe & More
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Cyber threats are evolving faster than ever. Attackers now combine social engineering, AI-driven manipulation, and cloud exploitation to breach targets once considered secure. From communication platforms to connected devices, every system that enhances convenience also expands the attack surface.
This edition of ThreatsDay Bulletin explores these converging risks and the safeguards that help

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: SaaS Breaches Start with Tokens - What Security Teams Must Watch
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Token theft is a leading cause of SaaS breaches. Discover why OAuth and API tokens are often overlooked and how security teams can strengthen token hygiene to prevent attacks.
Most companies in 2025 rely on a whole range of software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications to run their operations. However, the security of these applications depends on small pieces of data called tokens. Tokens, like

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: From Phishing to Malware: AI Becomes Russia's New Cyber Weapon in War on Ukraine
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Russian hackers' adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) in cyber attacks against Ukraine has reached a new level in the first half of 2025 (H1 2025), the country's State Service for Special Communications and Information Protection (SSSCIP) said.

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: Critical Exploit Lets Hackers Bypass Authentication in WordPress Service Finder Theme
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Threat actors are actively exploiting a critical security flaw impacting the Service Finder WordPress theme that makes it possible to gain unauthorized access to any account, including administrators, and take control of susceptible sites.
The authentication bypass vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-5947 (CVSS score: 9.8), affects the Service Finder Bookings, a WordPress plugin bundled with the
contentSnippet:

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: Hackers Exploit WordPress Sites to Power Next-Gen ClickFix Phishing Attacks
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Cybersecurity researchers are calling attention to a nefarious campaign targeting WordPress sites to make malicious JavaScript injections that are designed to redirect users to sketchy sites.
"Site visitors get injected content that was drive-by malware like fake Cloudflare verification," Sucuri researcher Puja Srivastava said in an analysis published last week.

creator: Bruce Schneier
title: Flok License Plate Surveillance
content:encoded:
The company Flok is surveilling us as we drive:

A retired veteran named Lee Schmidt wanted to know how often Norfolk, Virginia’s 176 Flock Safety automated license-plate-reader cameras were tracking him. The answer, according to a U.S. District Court lawsuit filed in September, was more than four times a day, or 526 times from mid-February to early July. No, there’s no warrant out for Schmidt’s arrest, nor is there a warrant for Schmidt’s co-plaintiff, Crystal Arrington, whom the system tagged 849 times in roughly the same period.

You might think this sounds like it violates the Fourth Amendment, which protects American citizens from unreasonable searches and seizures without probable cause. Well, so does the American Civil Liberties Union. Norfolk, Virginia Judge Jamilah LeCruise also agrees, and in 2024 she ruled that plate-reader data obtained without a search warrant couldn’t be used against a defendant in a robbery case.

Norfolk, Virginia Judge Jamilah LeCruise also agrees, and in 2024 she ruled that plate-reader data obtained without a search warrant couldn’t be used against a defendant in a robbery case.

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: Chinese Hackers Weaponize Open-Source Nezha Tool in New Attack Wave
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Threat actors with suspected ties to China have turned a legitimate open-source monitoring tool called Nezha into an attack weapon, using it to deliver a known malware called Gh0st RAT to targets.
The activity, observed by cybersecurity company Huntress in August 2025, is characterized by the use of an unusual technique called log poisoning (aka log injection) to plant a web shell on a web

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: Step Into the Password Graveyard… If You Dare (and Join the Live Session)
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Every year, weak passwords lead to millions in losses — and many of those breaches could have been stopped.
Attackers don’t need advanced tools; they just need one careless login.
For IT teams, that means endless resets, compliance struggles, and sleepless nights worrying about the next credential leak.
This Halloween, The Hacker News and Specops Software invite you to a live webinar: “

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: LockBit, Qilin, and DragonForce Join Forces to Dominate the Ransomware Ecosystem
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
Three prominent ransomware groups DragonForce, LockBit, and Qilin have announced a new strategic ransomware alliance, once underscoring continued shifts in the cyber threat landscape.
The coalition is seen as an attempt on the part of the financially motivated threat actors to conduct more effective ransomware attacks, ReliaQuest said in a report shared with The Hacker News.
"Announced shortly

title: Severe Framelink Figma MCP Vulnerability Lets Hackers Execute Code Remotely
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:

author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: OpenAI Disrupts Russian, North Korean, and Chinese Hackers Misusing ChatGPT for Cyberattacks
author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
content:
OpenAI on Tuesday said it disrupted three activity clusters for misusing its ChatGPT artificial intelligence (AI) tool to facilitate malware development.
This includes a Russian‑language threat actor, who is said to have used the chatbot to help develop and refine a remote access trojan (RAT), a credential stealer with an aim to evade detection. The operator also used several ChatGPT accounts to
